item.title: Quick Start for Hugo-Coder
item.description: Quick Start Link to heading To start using hugo-coder: Add the repository into your Hugo Project repository as a submodule, git submodule add https://github.com/luizdepra/hugo-coder.git themes/coder. Configure your config.toml. You can use this minimal configuration as a base. The config.toml inside the exampleSite from the exampleSite is also a good reference. Build your site with hugo serve and see the result at http://localhost:1313/. If you just want to test this theme, go to this page.

item.title: How to build a website with Hugo and host it on GitHub Pages
item.description: PIPELINE Link to heading This is a concise step by step rough-guide on how to build this website from scratch. Step 1 Link to heading

Welcome to the hugo-coder docs! Link to heading Basic Usage Link to heading Quick Start Configurations FAQ Extra Guides Link to heading Multilingual Mode Comment System Analytics Maintainers & Developers Link to heading Contributing

Multilingual-Mode Link to heading Available Languages Configure Languages Translation File Example Available Languages Link to heading This theme supports the following languages: Arabic Bengali Czech German English Spanish Finnish French Hebrew Hindi Hungarian Italian Japanese Malay Dutch Polish Brazilian Portuguese Romanian Russian Swedish Slovak Turkish Simplified Chinese Taiwan Chinese Configure languages Link to heading Go to this Hugo documentation page to configure one or multiple languages for your website.
